author: {'steamid': '76561198288058950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2721, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1709545613}
review:
Эта «игра» потрясающая. Очень красивая графика и в то же время удобная для пользователя. Кажется, что есть много других игр, которые сосредоточены на том или другом, но эта решает оба угла одновременно ... и это очень весело. С быстрыми обновлениями, которые будут приходить каждую неделю, я очень рад поиграть в нее и буду вынужден жить / играть / играть в СЕЙЧАС ... вместо того, чтобы ждать месяцами или НИКОГДА, чтобы другое обновление произошло из игры, которую я поставил энергия в.

Кстати .... Может показаться, что это так, потому что я просто перечитал то, что написал, но я абсолютно не связан с кем-либо, кто разработал эту игру (не с официальным лицом). Однако ... если вы хотите пересечь Google Планета Земля с помощью сканера подземелий и почтового индекса ... тогда обязательно загрузите это и играйте.

Мультиплеер тоже очень плавный, без каких-либо задержек ... и все очень дружелюбны.

Спасибо, разработчики, и я с нетерпением жду, что будет на следующей неделе.

author: {'steamid': '76561198300194029', 'num_games_owned': 48, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1592873595}
review: I will admit, some minigames are good and some minigames suck. There are a few that I would come back to replay, however they don't last long. If the developers fix some of the weaker minigames and increase the length or just add more stuff to the better minigames, this would be a more enjoyable experience. From -10 to 0 to 10, a 4/10. A game that needs a little touch-up here and there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116879965', 'num_games_owned': 1283, 'num_reviews': 6897, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1580151706}
review:
Кэнсэй (яп. 剣聖 кэнсэй, мастер меча) — почётный титул в древней Японии, дававшийся воину за искусное владение мечом. Самый известный кэнсэй — Миямото Мусаси(Бродягофаги щас завизжат), хотя некоторые его кэнсэем не считали. Исторические кэнсэи часто основывали школы владения мечом. Хотя нет такого письменного правила, название несёт такой престиж, что обычно считается, что одновременно может существовать не более одного кэнсэя.

В зависимости от употребляемого в написании иероглифа, «кэн» может означать как «меч» (剣), так и «кулак» (拳), и на Окинаве термин кэнсэй имеет значение «мастер кулака». Иероглиф 聖 («сэй») имеет также значение «святой». Так, титул Миямото Мусаси переводится как «Святой меч».

author: {'steamid': '76561198232440356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1561302175}
review:
It's free so try it if you want to, I'm not giving it a hard negative as maybe it works better with other systems, but it was buggy enough on my headset with huge load times so I'll probably delete it from my library. I don't think the devs are still working on it but listing the problems I was having in case they do. 

The start screen is amazing, and the graphics in general are reasonable to very good, but on WMR the controls aren't what is in the program (you need to work it out). It does work, but especially on the asteroid game, movement seemed quite bugged and made that game almost unplayable. The flight game was also unplayable. The movement was really coarse and didn't always reflect where you had your hands. Also I found if I turned away from the computer that I just kept traveling in the wrong direction. Since there was no way to rotate using the controllers, this was not fixable. Also it would have been far more fun to be able to do free flight rather than only having the choice of going through the rings.  Couldn't even get the spear toss to start as the spears wouldn't release properly. The ninja game worked, but you kind of just had to point your sword at incoming weapons as you couldn't cut them out of the air. 

Has both free movement and teleport, but no apparent way to rotate on the spot with the controller, which makes it awkward to play seated. (I don't quite understand why so many developers develop a game that can be played seated and then leave that out.) Loading times are HUGE. Basically put your headset down, go get a cup of coffee and come back in 5-15 mins between games. Didn't look through the other games as gave up waiting for them to load.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999946911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1569173145}
review:
Hey!  It's free so I hate to poo-poo it, but, it need lots of work.  I used an Oculus Rift S.  It looks great but some of the games can't be activated and the weapons are not implemented well.  Super idea, but ....

Recommended 'cause it's free to try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044983093', 'num_games_owned': 2355, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1518960141}
review:
[h1]Rudimentary is the word[/h1]

Thumbs up for effort, that's about it.

It's free, so you won't lose money if you try it, just time.

Ripple Effect is a collection of mini-games gathered around a few in-game hubs, of which one is multiplayer-oriented.

It has surprisingly good voiceover, and it's visually great (using assets maybe? if so, well used). Otherwise, my reaction would be summed up with a shrug.

I wouldn't say any of the mini-games are fun to play nor particularly well made. They are basically proofs of concept.

I don't regret taking the 40 minutes to check it out, if only to walk around the beautiful locations.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974522156', 'num_games_owned': 4394, 'num_reviews': 794, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1510973005}
review:
If I'm being honest even though this game is free I still feel ripped off. In fact I feel like I should have been paid for testing this pile of shit. It's a series of boring as shit mini games that feel like they've been rushed out in an hour at a Chinese coding sweatshop filled by 8 year old kids.

Tired of all these it's easy to make a VR game and throw it on steam shit games, this belongs on someones shitty gaming blog as a free download to show how I can put some assets together.

In my top 5 shitty VR games on Steam list.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986548802', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1507391248}
review:
What a terrible VR experience (as tested Q3 2017): While there are a lot of games to try out, the experience in each of them is subpart compared to other VR experiences available - maybe one or two games (the golem one and the rings for a few minutes) out of the bunch are acceptable at best.

General aspects:

[+] Log of mini games.
[-] Poor handling of weapons – the spear in particular – as for the sword and the hammers you barely need to move them – just shake your hands randomly and you will hit something.
[-] Very boring games overall.

Technical issues:

[-] Graphics not loading around you after the level loaded (can hear narration but the environment is not ready right away).

Other thoughts:

[=] An anemic person with an arthritis crisis could play this and succeed - Yes it is that un-compelling...
[=] I cannot understand how someone came up with 2-3 of these game and felt they were pleasant enough to justify making about 10 more of them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198393832440', 'num_games_owned': 53, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1571948315}
review: Ripple Effect is a fun grab bag of minigames, with new options being added regularly. Although the quality of the games varies, they all have simple controls and are easy to pick up and play. Since the game is free, it’s highly recommended. Good for showing off VR concepts and introducing new players to VR. Go Tarheels! @House Undergraduate Library

author: {'steamid': '76561197985220305', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1504720622}
review: Some naughty bugs are there to limit your experience with this in spite of some very good ideas. Still interesting to test as it's for free specially if you are new to the VR world. 5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026710867', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1505297128}
review: A good first attempt for a budding developer, but from a gameplay perspective it wasn't worth the time it took to download. I didn't find any of the games particularly fun, partly because they weren't challenging and partly because some didn't quite work in VR. Overall the games lack a bit of polish, which is to be somewhat expected when they're on a weekly release cycle.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961017729', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3428, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1708265731}
review: [b]Wow! So much free content![/b] This is another 'gaggle of minigames', but there is quite alot of them! Alot of work is put into this title, and the environments for the games are all very unique and fleshed out. There are some multiplayer experiences too! [i]My favorite was the game where you shot t-shirts at the naked people. I expect it is everyone's favorite too.[/i] Flying through the rings in the city was also nice. Everything works very well and it's not buggy at all. The menu/hub system is full too, although I think it needs more rainbow color scheme to the menu elements. I don't know if they are still adding new experiences 'each week', but there's close to a dozen or more games already, and it's free! [u]This is very generous.[/u] [spoiler]The Ripple Effect project is a joint project of Acumen Fund and IDEO funded by the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation to provide the poor with clean safe water started in 2009. It has projects in both India and Kenya.[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561197996398849', 'num_games_owned': 821, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1500226863}
review:
I really did not find any of the games in this fun really, any minigame I launched I just thought that it needed to hurry up and end.

The ninja game is just daft to, ninjas spawn inside the ground and there is no satisfaction at all in playing it.

I realise it is free, but honestly that shows in the below average standards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027858517', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1504126017}

author: {'steamid': '76561198066590240', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2800, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1503790830}
review:
So I tried all the mini-games and none of them were particularly fun.  Flying around like superman (race) was probably the most fun, but even then I could tell I would get bored within a few minutes.  Climbing multiplayer pvp sounded fun but I was the only person there.  Some of the mini-games were just awful, like the sword and board against rock monsters or the smash a goblin.  Others were just frustrating, like trying to spear a spider or trying to swing on branches to be unable to figure out why sometimes I swung and other times I just fell straight down even though I did the same technique.

The game is free, but Rec Room is also free and is at least 10x better in every way.  I hope this game does get better, maybe the dev can turn this around to a winner.  But I really doubt that will happen.  In any event, I have to rate the game as is now currently.  As such, I cannot recommend without future updates that significantly improve gameplay.

Rate 3/10 (please comment if a future update improves this game)

author: {'steamid': '76561198113653131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1502892520}
review:
I have not played all of this game yet but the bits I have played I have enjoyed . 
It seems to be a series of games with in a game my only criticism is that on some games -especially the spear throwing one 
the spears don`t fly too well and are almost impossible to accurately throw so you just end up tossing them and hoping for the best. 
Other games though are pretty good and generally good fun, controls on the whole are not too complicated and therefore you can concentrate on game lay as opposed to which button to press next. 
I enjoyed most of it so look forward to maybe them refining some of the in game dynamics and playing it some more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198367491843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1504047646}
review: Beautiful Game that is made up of mini games, both single and multiplayer games.  One multi player mini game is a climbing King of the Hill type game in which I ended up playing with the developers.  They were asking for my suggestions like whether the target should be moved to different places at the start of each new game.  Another mini game I liked was fighting the Rock men.  There was a soaring mini game which was fun but there was a rope swinging mini game where I could  not figure out how to move.  I highly recommend this game since I learned that the developers really care about their game  and will be releasing more mini games in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000929724', 'num_games_owned': 581, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1496404662}
review:
Beautiful from the get-go. Even the loading screens shine through. 
Amazing atmosphere, and a great community already on such a fresh game.

An active dev played a few games with us, and listened to our suggestions and bug-hunted with us. It was so warm and cosy there.

Finally, a promise for expansions and updates, all while the game is free? This is a VR Gem, and I highly implore you to try it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198357044534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1496286215}
review:
This "game" is amazing. Very graphically awesome and user friendly at the same time. It seems that there are a lot of other games out there that focus on one or the other, but this one is tackling both angles at the same time...and it's a ton of fun. With the fast paced updates to come each week, I am very excited to play it and be pushed into living/playing/gaming in the NOW...versus waiting for months or NEVER for another update to happen from a game that I put my energy into. 

Btw....It might seem like it as I just re-read what I wrote, but I have absolutely zero affiliation with anyone that developed this game (not a spokesperson). However...if you would like to cross Google Earth with a dungeon crawler and a zip-line....then definitley download this and play it. 

The multi-player is very fluid too with no lag noticed whatsoever...and everyone is super friendly. 

Thanks devs and I look forward to see what's up for next week.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080279555', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1496255990}
review:
Ripple Effect definitely has potential to a be an awesome VR game. It is very similar to The Lab (which I very much recommend) in the sense that this is a free VR title that offers multiple mini games  inside  it. 

The textures are pretty well done, but the quality of the games is where I think improvement needs to be. They just don't seem to be as fun for me as other titles. Also, the game seems to be released unfinished since there are about 6+ games that will be added in later.  So I wish that release was held off a little bit until the full amount  of mini  games  could be implemented. 

Otherwise,  it is definitely not a bad title and it's flippin' free so I don't see a reason to not try it. Certainly  better than the majority of VR titles available. 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198216402299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1500005180}
review:
Tried a bit on my Oculus. Was pretty cool. I had fun and the game ran smooth.

Nice effects and visuals. Cool assortment of vastly different games to try.  Can't wait to try more upcoming mini games. 

Kudos to the Dev. This is one of the better free VR games on steam right now. Can't go wrong giving it a go!

author: {'steamid': '76561197996502435', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1457, 'last_played': 1507000932}
review: This is one of the best free VR games out there. There are more experiences and things to do in this game than almost any other VR game. Mountain king is particularly impressive. Looking forward to their weekly updates
